title: Bicycle Repair | Student Centers | University of Illinois at Chicago
text: Student Centers provide students, staff and visitors with an opportunity to use bike fix-it stations, rent bicycle repair tools and/or a bicycle air pumps on campus. The fix-it stations are available for use at anytime. There are no restrictions on who can rent the pump or bike repair kit, however a valid identification (icard*, Driver’s License, or State ID) must be presented upon rental. The ID will be returned to the renter when the repair tools are checked and returned to the Building Manager. Below are the locations and services in Student Centers. For further information regarding bike repairs, bike amenities and benefits of biking, please visit the Office of Sustainability webpage.
SCE, outside, left side of front entrance from Halsted Street side (has a built in bicycle pump)
SCE, outside, left side of front entrance from campus side
Note: In order to rent the bike tool kit or portable air pump, student or staff must leave icard or DL/State ID with the Building Manager.
828 S. Wolcott Avenue, 312-413-5200 1st floor Building Manager’s service window
Note: In order to rent the bike tool kit or portable air pump, student or staff must leave icard or DL/State ID with the Building Manager.
1st floor equipment desk, (must swipe icard to gain entrance to building for fee paying members and current students)
Note: SRF only accepts icard or Visitor icard to rent the repair kit.
